![Image 1: Samuel Luckhurst](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article22855086.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_WhatsApp-Image-2022-01-24-at-140305.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Samuel Luckhurst](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/samuel-luckhurst/)Chief Manchester United writer

*   15:33, 1 DEC 2024
*   Updated15:37, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Amad was brilliant against Everton](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491894.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187701412.jpg)

Amad was brilliant against Everton

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Jarrad Branthwaite did not get his move to Manchester United in the summer yet he stepped up as their 12th man against Everton.

A deflection and a dozy pass from the centre back gifted United both of their first-half goals to turn the game on its head. Branthwaite skulked off at half-time with his head bowed, tugging his shirt in the hope it would be big enough to conceal his embarrassed expression. There was a half left to play yet Everton were done.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were otherwise unconvincing in a first half so troubling that Ruben Amorim was plotting a double substitution at half-time. Branthwaite's collapse caused his teammates to also fold. United ran away with it without running much.

After two 3-0 reverses at Old Trafford, the thrashings are being meted out by the home side. There was a hearty and celebratory rendition of "Amorim's Red and White Army" from the Stretford End before the hour, with victory already assured. This was United's first four-goal victory in the Premier League since the opening day of the 2021-22 season.

**READ MORE: [Player ratings vs Everton as Amad brilliant](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30490967)**

**READ MORE: [United vs Everton reaction](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-vs-everton-live-30489781)**

United are literally on the up. The three points have elevated them to the heady heights of ninth in the table, the first time they have been in the top half since October. Their goal difference is finally a positive figure.

The only anger vented by the matchgoers was over the callous ticket price hike by the Ineos cabal. Sir Jim Ratcliffe's Manchester roots have not spared him from the vitriol after spinning supporters a hollow working-class hero yarn.

On the pitch, Amorim had the luxury of introducing the returning Harry Maguire and Luke Shaw before the hour to grant Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui a breather. The festive season commenced with a cheery rendition of "Five Cantonas". In a week the other Manchester side squandered a hefty advantage with a quarter of an hour to play, there was no chance of Everton emulating Feyenoord.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee got two goals apiece but the game belonged to Amad. He made three of the four possible and is the perfect profile of player for Amorim.

It was only nine months ago that Omari Forson (remember him?) started ahead of Amad. Amad's intensity and selflessness have enabled him to swiftly adapt to Amorim's demands. Forson has played three times for Monza.

Rashford's penchant for performing under a new manager (or head coach) has continued with the latest incumbent. His charge and spontaneous strike for United's third goal was reminiscent of his 2022-23 zenith. Rashford is one shy of matching his meagre eight-goal haul of last term.

Everton ordered United to attack the Stretford End in the first half, as they had on their last two visits. Those fixtures ended 2-0. This time it was double that. United fans were "Olé"ing as early as the 75th minute.

Amorim was more animated and impatient at 0-0 than on his previous appearances in the United technical area. He had to clap his hands to alert Casemiro to receive the ball, lamented a risk-aversive pass from De Ligt and in the 19th minute instructed Diogo Dalot to come yet he opted to go.

Before he scored, Zirkzee was berated for being out of position to press. It happened a second time moments later and Amorim reactively turned to the dugout and told Mason Mount and Alejandro Garnacho to warm up. That was in the 24th minute. They were not required at the interval after all.

Zirkzee was the third striker to start in Amorim's third match and all three have scored. Zirkzee favours a deeper role and initially had some joy avoiding duels with Branthwaite but once Everton seized the initiative his positioning began to irk Amorim. Zirkzee and Rasmus Hojlund, whose intense pressing resulted in a goal after 48 seconds against Bodo/Glimt, are polar opposites.

Still, Zirkzee rallied to score his first United goal in 18 games for his second in 19. James Tarkowski's dithering defending charitably made another possible and Zirkzee's body language altered markedly.

His teammates were pleased as punch and he celebrated by pretending to fire a machine gun. He has some way to go to be considered a sharp shooter, though Zirkzee's deeper presence accelerated the attack for Rashford's clinical second goal.

Amorim's wing-back strategy is starting to bear fruit. Amad forced the error from Branthwaite to make it 2-0 through an intense press and his recall effectively cements his status as a first-teamer again.

Amad had earlier irked Amorim by scooping the ball wide from Zirkzee's pass yet he has demonstrated over his four years at United he is not lacking in resilience. He has three assists in two starts under Amorim.

It is a misconception Amad is one of Ten Hag's legacies when his first start under him came in May. There were only ten more and he has slotted in admirably into Amorim's challenging 3-4-3 formation.

Branthwaite had crucially cut out a couple of early crosses before making more decisive contact with Rashford's half-volley to give United a fortuitous lead on 34 minutes. Branthwaite's intervention sent the ball in the opposite direction to the prone Jordan Pickford.

Everton's followers were bullish for half an hour yet when the fourth goal went in, thousands trudged down the gangways to the nearest exit and boos soundtracked Sean Dyche's first round of substitutions. Former United captain Ashley Young departed to a standing ovation yet many in the Everton end did not applaud him.

They had scored fewer goals than United at kick-off and the inclusion of the ungainly Beto did not increase their prospects. At 0-0, he rolled the ball the wrong side of the net with their one sighter.

Branthwaite put it into his own net.

data: {"title":"Amad responds perfectly to Ruben Amorim's touchline reactions in Man United win","description":"Man United secured a first four-goal victory in the Premier League in Ruben Amorim's first league match in charge at Old Trafford.","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/amad-responds-perfectly-ruben-amorims-30490976","content":"Amad responds perfectly to Ruben Amorim's touchline reactions in Manchester United win - Samuel Luckhurst - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                     

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

Amad responds perfectly to Ruben Amorim's touchline reactions in Manchester United win
======================================================================================

Man United secured a first four-goal victory in the Premier League in Ruben Amorim's first league match in charge at Old Trafford.
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments4](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/amad-responds-perfectly-ruben-amorims-30490976#comments-wrapper "Comments")

![Image 1: Samuel Luckhurst](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article22855086.ece/ALTERNATES/s98/0_WhatsApp-Image-2022-01-24-at-140305.jpg)

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)opinion

By

[Samuel Luckhurst](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/samuel-luckhurst/)Chief Manchester United writer

*   15:33, 1 DEC 2024
*   Updated15:37, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 2: Amad was brilliant against Everton](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491894.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187701412.jpg)

Amad was brilliant against Everton

![Image 3: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Jarrad Branthwaite did not get his move to Manchester United in the summer yet he stepped up as their 12th man against Everton.

A deflection and a dozy pass from the centre back gifted United both of their first-half goals to turn the game on its head. Branthwaite skulked off at half-time with his head bowed, tugging his shirt in the hope it would be big enough to conceal his embarrassed expression. There was a half left to play yet Everton were done.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were otherwise unconvincing in a first half so troubling that Ruben Amorim was plotting a double substitution at half-time. Branthwaite's collapse caused his teammates to also fold. United ran away with it without running much.

After two 3-0 reverses at Old Trafford, the thrashings are being meted out by the home side. There was a hearty and celebratory rendition of "Amorim's Red and White Army" from the Stretford End before the hour, with victory already assured. This was United's first four-goal victory in the Premier League since the opening day of the 2021-22 season.

**READ MORE: [Player ratings vs Everton as Amad brilliant](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30490967)**

**READ MORE: [United vs Everton reaction](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/manchester-united-vs-everton-live-30489781)**

United are literally on the up. The three points have elevated them to the heady heights of ninth in the table, the first time they have been in the top half since October. Their goal difference is finally a positive figure.

The only anger vented by the matchgoers was over the callous ticket price hike by the Ineos cabal. Sir Jim Ratcliffe's Manchester roots have not spared him from the vitriol after spinning supporters a hollow working-class hero yarn.

On the pitch, Amorim had the luxury of introducing the returning Harry Maguire and Luke Shaw before the hour to grant Matthijs de Ligt and Noussair Mazraoui a breather. The festive season commenced with a cheery rendition of "Five Cantonas". In a week the other Manchester side squandered a hefty advantage with a quarter of an hour to play, there was no chance of Everton emulating Feyenoord.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee got two goals apiece but the game belonged to Amad. He made three of the four possible and is the perfect profile of player for Amorim.

It was only nine months ago that Omari Forson (remember him?) started ahead of Amad. Amad's intensity and selflessness have enabled him to swiftly adapt to Amorim's demands. Forson has played three times for Monza.

Rashford's penchant for performing under a new manager (or head coach) has continued with the latest incumbent. His charge and spontaneous strike for United's third goal was reminiscent of his 2022-23 zenith. Rashford is one shy of matching his meagre eight-goal haul of last term.

Everton ordered United to attack the Stretford End in the first half, as they had on their last two visits. Those fixtures ended 2-0. This time it was double that. United fans were "Olé"ing as early as the 75th minute.

Amorim was more animated and impatient at 0-0 than on his previous appearances in the United technical area. He had to clap his hands to alert Casemiro to receive the ball, lamented a risk-aversive pass from De Ligt and in the 19th minute instructed Diogo Dalot to come yet he opted to go.

Before he scored, Zirkzee was berated for being out of position to press. It happened a second time moments later and Amorim reactively turned to the dugout and told Mason Mount and Alejandro Garnacho to warm up. That was in the 24th minute. They were not required at the interval after all.

Zirkzee was the third striker to start in Amorim's third match and all three have scored. Zirkzee favours a deeper role and initially had some joy avoiding duels with Branthwaite but once Everton seized the initiative his positioning began to irk Amorim. Zirkzee and Rasmus Hojlund, whose intense pressing resulted in a goal after 48 seconds against Bodo/Glimt, are polar opposites.

Still, Zirkzee rallied to score his first United goal in 18 games for his second in 19. James Tarkowski's dithering defending charitably made another possible and Zirkzee's body language altered markedly.

His teammates were pleased as punch and he celebrated by pretending to fire a machine gun. He has some way to go to be considered a sharp shooter, though Zirkzee's deeper presence accelerated the attack for Rashford's clinical second goal.

Amorim's wing-back strategy is starting to bear fruit. Amad forced the error from Branthwaite to make it 2-0 through an intense press and his recall effectively cements his status as a first-teamer again.

Amad had earlier irked Amorim by scooping the ball wide from Zirkzee's pass yet he has demonstrated over his four years at United he is not lacking in resilience. He has three assists in two starts under Amorim.

It is a misconception Amad is one of Ten Hag's legacies when his first start under him came in May. There were only ten more and he has slotted in admirably into Amorim's challenging 3-4-3 formation.

Branthwaite had crucially cut out a couple of early crosses before making more decisive contact with Rashford's half-volley to give United a fortuitous lead on 34 minutes. Branthwaite's intervention sent the ball in the opposite direction to the prone Jordan Pickford.

Everton's followers were bullish for half an hour yet when the fourth goal went in, thousands trudged down the gangways to the nearest exit and boos soundtracked Sean Dyche's first round of substitutions. Former United captain Ashley Young departed to a standing ovation yet many in the Everton end did not applaud him.

They had scored fewer goals than United at kick-off and the inclusion of the ungainly Beto did not increase their prospects. At 0-0, he rolled the ball the wrong side of the net with their one sighter.

Branthwaite put it into his own net.

===============
                        

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

'I'm going to have to stop taking my kids to the match - it's appalling'
========================================================================

Manchester United fans are fuming after the club announced it was raising prices and scrapping concessions
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/im-going-stop-taking-kids-30491557#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Chris Slater](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/chris-slater/)Senior Reporter

*   15:32, 1 DEC 2024
*   Updated15:43, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491478.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_014JPG.jpg)

Young United fans hold up a banner during the protest before Sunday's match with Everton at Old Traffiorf (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

In amongst the anger, there was a stark reminder of what this was all about. [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and Everton fans had gathered outside [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) ahead of their [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) match today to protest against ticket price increases.

United this week sparked fury when they announced a mid-season decision to raise matchday ticket prices to £66 per game, with no concessions for children or pensioners.

Hundreds of Reds' fans congregated and unfurled a banner reading "stop exploiting loyalty." A chorus of angry and abusive chants were aimed at both the Glazer family and new minority owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe.

**READ MORE: [Football fans protest LIVE: Man United and Man City supporters join forces over ticket prices](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/football-protest-live-man-united-30490216)**

Amidst the wall of noise and red smoke bombs, three young fans shuffled their way to the front. They were holding up a homemade cardboard sign which read: "Man Utd - ripping off kids." An adult supporter ran over and pointed at them as the fans sang "£66, you're taking the p\*\*s."

Stood not far from them was lifelong Red Ross Jenkins, 41, from Sale. On his shoulders sat his eight year-old son William. He too had a sign. "It's my fault, so charge me more," it read.

  

![Image 3](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491833.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_IMG_4525jpeg.jpg)

Ross Jenkins and son William

Ross doesn't have a season-ticket, but is a long-term 'One United' member and attends games regularly with William and his brother.

However, he said: "Overnight we have been priced out of tickets. I accept some price increases will happen. But to remove a child's price is absolutely appalling."

Ross said without concession prices, he would be unable to afford to take his kids to the match, and that if they couldn't go, he wouldn't either.

  

![Image 4](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491840.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_007JPG.jpg)

Fans protested in front of the Trinity statue (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

"It breaks your heart," he said. "As a dad its one of things that you look forward to and relish doing. I've always been a big believer in bringing them to see football live, not just watching it on TV.

"And how is Manchester United going to be sustained without these young fans who are the future of the club? It's just so sad." "If they can't go I won't be going," he added. "'I'm also thinking of asking for a refund for my membership."

Anthony Talbot, 49, and his 11-year-old son Finn, from [Wythenshawe](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/wythenshawe), have season tickets which are at this stage unaffected. However they said they believed all fans had to "make a stand" against the decision.

"They are taking the p\*\*s," Anthony said. "They are forcing young and working class fans away from the club. For example, a dad who wants to bring his three kids, is looking at paying getting on towards 300 quid. That's before your travel, your food and everything else.

  

![Image 5](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491551.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_013JPG.jpg)

Anthony Talbot (centre right) and son Finn (right) at the protest (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

"People just aren't going to be able to afford that. They are forcing supporters out. It's as if they just want the corporate fans in the ground and it will become lifeless."

Alex Sinau, 42, from Northenden, who was at the game with ten-year-old son Eitan, said: "It's terrible. I have a season ticket but I have to buy a ticket for my son. And it's a massive difference from like 15 pounds to 66.

"My daughter isn't interested in football yet, but if she did start wanting to come it's going to be so much money. I'm very angry. Instead of bringing young kids and the younger generation closer to football, they are pushing them away."

  

![Image 6](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491845.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_016JPG.jpg)

Hundreds gathered to protest against the ticket price rises (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

Another banner, aimed at Failsworth-born Sir Jim Ratcliffe, read: "Local lad Sir Jim charges £66 for OAPS+Juniors. Stop exploiting loyalty."

Fans sang "Manchester boy, you're having a laugh", "you're not one us, you greedy \*\*\*\*" at Sir Jim amongst chants deriding the Glazer family and urging them to fully sell the club.

The protest was organised by United fan group The 1958. Spokesman Steve Crompton told the _Manchester Evening News_ he reacted with "utter disgust" when he first heard of the planned price increases, which the club didn't consult on.

  

![Image 7](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491843.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_IMG_4528jpeg.jpg)

The 1958 group spokesman Steve Crompton

"It's an absolute disgrace. They have not consulted with anyone, they have just decided 'this is what we're going to do.' This must be Sir Jim Ratcliffe's way of 'putting the Manchester back into Manchester United.'

"I am going to assume he's a smart man, as he's made a bob or two during his life. He knew what we was getting on board with. If things are so bad he has to penalise match going fans like this, then it really is a shocking state of affairs."

"I have spoken to three or four supporters clubs who are worried about closing," Steve continued. "They rely on filling coaches to the game, and if they can't fill the coach because people can't afford tickets, then they will die. Match-going fans are being penalised, it's not on."

  

![Image 8](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491846.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/1_IMG_4527jpeg.jpg)

Everton fans Dave Kelly (left) and David Fehily (right)

Asked if he thought the club may reverse their decision given the level of anger, Steve said: "probably not." "But will we keep fighting? Absolutely. This is the start, we are working with other Premier League teams. Unity is our strength and our voice will only get louder."

Everton fan David Fehily, 61, and chair of the club's fan advisory board, Dave Kelly, 66, were among those of the Blue persuasion who came to show their support for the campaign spearheaded by The Football Supporters Association.

"We believe this isn't a club-by-club issue, this is a national issue" David said. "Everton is unusual as we have a high number of juniors and OAPs who this would affect. We have to stand together."

data: {"title":"'I'm going to have to stop taking my kids to the match - it's appalling'","description":"Manchester United fans are fuming after the club announced it was raising prices and scrapping concessions","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/im-going-stop-taking-kids-30491557","content":"'I'm going to have to stop taking my kids to the match - it's appalling' - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

'I'm going to have to stop taking my kids to the match - it's appalling'
========================================================================

Manchester United fans are fuming after the club announced it was raising prices and scrapping concessions
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments12](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/im-going-stop-taking-kids-30491557#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Chris Slater](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/chris-slater/)Senior Reporter

*   15:32, 1 DEC 2024
*   Updated15:43, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491478.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_014JPG.jpg)

Young United fans hold up a banner during the protest before Sunday's match with Everton at Old Traffiorf (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

In amongst the anger, there was a stark reminder of what this was all about. [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and Everton fans had gathered outside [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) ahead of their [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) match today to protest against ticket price increases.

United this week sparked fury when they announced a mid-season decision to raise matchday ticket prices to £66 per game, with no concessions for children or pensioners.

Hundreds of Reds' fans congregated and unfurled a banner reading "stop exploiting loyalty." A chorus of angry and abusive chants were aimed at both the Glazer family and new minority owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe.

**READ MORE: [Football fans protest LIVE: Man United and Man City supporters join forces over ticket prices](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/football-protest-live-man-united-30490216)**

Amidst the wall of noise and red smoke bombs, three young fans shuffled their way to the front. They were holding up a homemade cardboard sign which read: "Man Utd - ripping off kids." An adult supporter ran over and pointed at them as the fans sang "£66, you're taking the p\*\*s."

Stood not far from them was lifelong Red Ross Jenkins, 41, from Sale. On his shoulders sat his eight year-old son William. He too had a sign. "It's my fault, so charge me more," it read.

  

![Image 3](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491833.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_IMG_4525jpeg.jpg)

Ross Jenkins and son William

Ross doesn't have a season-ticket, but is a long-term 'One United' member and attends games regularly with William and his brother.

However, he said: "Overnight we have been priced out of tickets. I accept some price increases will happen. But to remove a child's price is absolutely appalling."

Ross said without concession prices, he would be unable to afford to take his kids to the match, and that if they couldn't go, he wouldn't either.

  

![Image 4](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491840.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_007JPG.jpg)

Fans protested in front of the Trinity statue (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

"It breaks your heart," he said. "As a dad its one of things that you look forward to and relish doing. I've always been a big believer in bringing them to see football live, not just watching it on TV.

"And how is Manchester United going to be sustained without these young fans who are the future of the club? It's just so sad." "If they can't go I won't be going," he added. "'I'm also thinking of asking for a refund for my membership."

Anthony Talbot, 49, and his 11-year-old son Finn, from [Wythenshawe](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/wythenshawe), have season tickets which are at this stage unaffected. However they said they believed all fans had to "make a stand" against the decision.

"They are taking the p\*\*s," Anthony said. "They are forcing young and working class fans away from the club. For example, a dad who wants to bring his three kids, is looking at paying getting on towards 300 quid. That's before your travel, your food and everything else.

  

![Image 5](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491551.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_013JPG.jpg)

Anthony Talbot (centre right) and son Finn (right) at the protest (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

"People just aren't going to be able to afford that. They are forcing supporters out. It's as if they just want the corporate fans in the ground and it will become lifeless."

Alex Sinau, 42, from Northenden, who was at the game with ten-year-old son Eitan, said: "It's terrible. I have a season ticket but I have to buy a ticket for my son. And it's a massive difference from like 15 pounds to 66.

"My daughter isn't interested in football yet, but if she did start wanting to come it's going to be so much money. I'm very angry. Instead of bringing young kids and the younger generation closer to football, they are pushing them away."

  

![Image 6](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491845.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_016JPG.jpg)

Hundreds gathered to protest against the ticket price rises (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

Another banner, aimed at Failsworth-born Sir Jim Ratcliffe, read: "Local lad Sir Jim charges £66 for OAPS+Juniors. Stop exploiting loyalty."

Fans sang "Manchester boy, you're having a laugh", "you're not one us, you greedy \*\*\*\*" at Sir Jim amongst chants deriding the Glazer family and urging them to fully sell the club.

The protest was organised by United fan group The 1958. Spokesman Steve Crompton told the _Manchester Evening News_ he reacted with "utter disgust" when he first heard of the planned price increases, which the club didn't consult on.

  

![Image 7](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491843.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_IMG_4528jpeg.jpg)

The 1958 group spokesman Steve Crompton

"It's an absolute disgrace. They have not consulted with anyone, they have just decided 'this is what we're going to do.' This must be Sir Jim Ratcliffe's way of 'putting the Manchester back into Manchester United.'

"I am going to assume he's a smart man, as he's made a bob or two during his life. He knew what we was getting on board with. If things are so bad he has to penalise match going fans like this, then it really is a shocking state of affairs."

"I have spoken to three or four supporters clubs who are worried about closing," Steve continued. "They rely on filling coaches to the game, and if they can't fill the coach because people can't afford tickets, then they will die. Match-going fans are being penalised, it's not on."

  

![Image 8](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491846.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/1_IMG_4527jpeg.jpg)

Everton fans Dave Kelly (left) and David Fehily (right)

Asked if he thought the club may reverse their decision given the level of anger, Steve said: "probably not." "But will we keep fighting? Absolutely. This is the start, we are working with other Premier League teams. Unity is our strength and our voice will only get louder."

Everton fan David Fehily, 61, and chair of the club's fan advisory board, Dave Kelly, 66, were among those of the Blue persuasion who came to show their support for the campaign spearheaded by The Football Supporters Association.

"We believe this isn't a club-by-club issue, this is a national issue" David said. "Everton is unusual as we have a high number of juniors and OAPs who this would affect. We have to stand together."

event: data
data: {"title":"'I'm going to have to stop taking my kids to the match - it's appalling'","description":"Manchester United fans are fuming after the club announced it was raising prices and scrapping concessions","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/im-going-stop-taking-kids-30491557","content":"'I'm going to have to stop taking my kids to the match - it's appalling' - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                    

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

'I'm going to have to stop taking my kids to the match - it's appalling'
========================================================================

Manchester United fans are fuming after the club announced it was raising prices and scrapping concessions
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments12](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/im-going-stop-taking-kids-30491557#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Chris Slater](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/chris-slater/)Senior Reporter

*   15:32, 1 DEC 2024
*   Updated15:43, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491478.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_014JPG.jpg)

Young United fans hold up a banner during the protest before Sunday's match with Everton at Old Traffiorf (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

In amongst the anger, there was a stark reminder of what this was all about. [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and Everton fans had gathered outside [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) ahead of their [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) match today to protest against ticket price increases.

United this week sparked fury when they announced a mid-season decision to raise matchday ticket prices to £66 per game, with no concessions for children or pensioners.

Hundreds of Reds' fans congregated and unfurled a banner reading "stop exploiting loyalty." A chorus of angry and abusive chants were aimed at both the Glazer family and new minority owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe.

**READ MORE: [Football fans protest LIVE: Man United and Man City supporters join forces over ticket prices](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/football-protest-live-man-united-30490216)**

Amidst the wall of noise and red smoke bombs, three young fans shuffled their way to the front. They were holding up a homemade cardboard sign which read: "Man Utd - ripping off kids." An adult supporter ran over and pointed at them as the fans sang "£66, you're taking the p\*\*s."

Stood not far from them was lifelong Red Ross Jenkins, 41, from Sale. On his shoulders sat his eight year-old son William. He too had a sign. "It's my fault, so charge me more," it read.

  

![Image 3](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491833.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_IMG_4525jpeg.jpg)

Ross Jenkins and son William

Ross doesn't have a season-ticket, but is a long-term 'One United' member and attends games regularly with William and his brother.

However, he said: "Overnight we have been priced out of tickets. I accept some price increases will happen. But to remove a child's price is absolutely appalling."

Ross said without concession prices, he would be unable to afford to take his kids to the match, and that if they couldn't go, he wouldn't either.

  

![Image 4](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491840.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_007JPG.jpg)

Fans protested in front of the Trinity statue (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

"It breaks your heart," he said. "As a dad its one of things that you look forward to and relish doing. I've always been a big believer in bringing them to see football live, not just watching it on TV.

"And how is Manchester United going to be sustained without these young fans who are the future of the club? It's just so sad." "If they can't go I won't be going," he added. "'I'm also thinking of asking for a refund for my membership."

Anthony Talbot, 49, and his 11-year-old son Finn, from [Wythenshawe](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/wythenshawe), have season tickets which are at this stage unaffected. However they said they believed all fans had to "make a stand" against the decision.

"They are taking the p\*\*s," Anthony said. "They are forcing young and working class fans away from the club. For example, a dad who wants to bring his three kids, is looking at paying getting on towards 300 quid. That's before your travel, your food and everything else.

  

![Image 5](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491551.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_013JPG.jpg)

Anthony Talbot (centre right) and son Finn (right) at the protest (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

"People just aren't going to be able to afford that. They are forcing supporters out. It's as if they just want the corporate fans in the ground and it will become lifeless."

Alex Sinau, 42, from Northenden, who was at the game with ten-year-old son Eitan, said: "It's terrible. I have a season ticket but I have to buy a ticket for my son. And it's a massive difference from like 15 pounds to 66.

"My daughter isn't interested in football yet, but if she did start wanting to come it's going to be so much money. I'm very angry. Instead of bringing young kids and the younger generation closer to football, they are pushing them away."

  

![Image 6](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491845.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_016JPG.jpg)

Hundreds gathered to protest against the ticket price rises (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

Another banner, aimed at Failsworth-born Sir Jim Ratcliffe, read: "Local lad Sir Jim charges £66 for OAPS+Juniors. Stop exploiting loyalty."

Fans sang "Manchester boy, you're having a laugh", "you're not one us, you greedy \*\*\*\*" at Sir Jim amongst chants deriding the Glazer family and urging them to fully sell the club.

The protest was organised by United fan group The 1958. Spokesman Steve Crompton told the _Manchester Evening News_ he reacted with "utter disgust" when he first heard of the planned price increases, which the club didn't consult on.

  

![Image 7](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491843.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_IMG_4528jpeg.jpg)

The 1958 group spokesman Steve Crompton

"It's an absolute disgrace. They have not consulted with anyone, they have just decided 'this is what we're going to do.' This must be Sir Jim Ratcliffe's way of 'putting the Manchester back into Manchester United.'

"I am going to assume he's a smart man, as he's made a bob or two during his life. He knew what we was getting on board with. If things are so bad he has to penalise match going fans like this, then it really is a shocking state of affairs."

"I have spoken to three or four supporters clubs who are worried about closing," Steve continued. "They rely on filling coaches to the game, and if they can't fill the coach because people can't afford tickets, then they will die. Match-going fans are being penalised, it's not on."

  

![Image 8](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491846.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/1_IMG_4527jpeg.jpg)

Everton fans Dave Kelly (left) and David Fehily (right)

Asked if he thought the club may reverse their decision given the level of anger, Steve said: "probably not." "But will we keep fighting? Absolutely. This is the start, we are working with other Premier League teams. Unity is our strength and our voice will only get louder."

Everton fan David Fehily, 61, and chair of the club's fan advisory board, Dave Kelly, 66, were among those of the Blue persuasion who came to show their support for the campaign spearheaded by The Football Supporters Association.

"We believe this isn't a club-by-club issue, this is a national issue" David said. "Everton is unusual as we have a high number of juniors and OAPs who this would affect. We have to stand together."

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

'I'm going to have to stop taking my kids to the match - it's appalling'
========================================================================

Manchester United fans are fuming after the club announced it was raising prices and scrapping concessions
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments12](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/im-going-stop-taking-kids-30491557#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Chris Slater](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/chris-slater/)Senior Reporter

*   15:32, 1 DEC 2024
*   Updated15:43, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491478.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_014JPG.jpg)

Young United fans hold up a banner during the protest before Sunday's match with Everton at Old Traffiorf (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

In amongst the anger, there was a stark reminder of what this was all about. [Manchester United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) and Everton fans had gathered outside [Old Trafford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/old-trafford) ahead of their [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) match today to protest against ticket price increases.

United this week sparked fury when they announced a mid-season decision to raise matchday ticket prices to £66 per game, with no concessions for children or pensioners.

[](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)[Comments](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/bruno-fernandes-sends-man-united-30469807?int_source=mantis_rec_top&int_medium=web&int_campaign=more_like_this_top_comments#comments-wrapper "Comments")

Hundreds of Reds' fans congregated and unfurled a banner reading "stop exploiting loyalty." A chorus of angry and abusive chants were aimed at both the Glazer family and new minority owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe.

**READ MORE: [Football fans protest LIVE: Man United and Man City supporters join forces over ticket prices](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/football-protest-live-man-united-30490216)**

Amidst the wall of noise and red smoke bombs, three young fans shuffled their way to the front. They were holding up a homemade cardboard sign which read: "Man Utd - ripping off kids." An adult supporter ran over and pointed at them as the fans sang "£66, you're taking the p\*\*s."

Stood not far from them was lifelong Red Ross Jenkins, 41, from Sale. On his shoulders sat his eight year-old son William. He too had a sign. "It's my fault, so charge me more," it read.

  

![Image 64](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491833.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_IMG_4525jpeg.jpg)

Ross Jenkins and son William

Ross doesn't have a season-ticket, but is a long-term 'One United' member and attends games regularly with William and his brother.

However, he said: "Overnight we have been priced out of tickets. I accept some price increases will happen. But to remove a child's price is absolutely appalling."

Ross said without concession prices, he would be unable to afford to take his kids to the match, and that if they couldn't go, he wouldn't either.

  

![Image 65](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491840.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_007JPG.jpg)

Fans protested in front of the Trinity statue (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

"It breaks your heart," he said. "As a dad its one of things that you look forward to and relish doing. I've always been a big believer in bringing them to see football live, not just watching it on TV.

"And how is Manchester United going to be sustained without these young fans who are the future of the club? It's just so sad." "If they can't go I won't be going," he added. "'I'm also thinking of asking for a refund for my membership."

Anthony Talbot, 49, and his 11-year-old son Finn, from [Wythenshawe](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/wythenshawe), have season tickets which are at this stage unaffected. However they said they believed all fans had to "make a stand" against the decision.

"They are taking the p\*\*s," Anthony said. "They are forcing young and working class fans away from the club. For example, a dad who wants to bring his three kids, is looking at paying getting on towards 300 quid. That's before your travel, your food and everything else.

  

![Image 66](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491551.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_013JPG.jpg)

Anthony Talbot (centre right) and son Finn (right) at the protest (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

"People just aren't going to be able to afford that. They are forcing supporters out. It's as if they just want the corporate fans in the ground and it will become lifeless."

Alex Sinau, 42, from Northenden, who was at the game with ten-year-old son Eitan, said: "It's terrible. I have a season ticket but I have to buy a ticket for my son. And it's a massive difference from like 15 pounds to 66.

"My daughter isn't interested in football yet, but if she did start wanting to come it's going to be so much money. I'm very angry. Instead of bringing young kids and the younger generation closer to football, they are pushing them away."

  

![Image 67](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491845.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_JRP_MEN_011224_protest_016JPG.jpg)

Hundreds gathered to protest against the ticket price rises (Image: Jason Roberts /Manchester Evening News)

Another banner, aimed at Failsworth-born Sir Jim Ratcliffe, read: "Local lad Sir Jim charges £66 for OAPS+Juniors. Stop exploiting loyalty."

Fans sang "Manchester boy, you're having a laugh", "you're not one us, you greedy \*\*\*\*" at Sir Jim amongst chants deriding the Glazer family and urging them to fully sell the club.

The protest was organised by United fan group The 1958. Spokesman Steve Crompton told the _Manchester Evening News_ he reacted with "utter disgust" when he first heard of the planned price increases, which the club didn't consult on.

  

![Image 68](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491843.ece/ALTERNATES/s615b/0_IMG_4528jpeg.jpg)

The 1958 group spokesman Steve Crompton

"It's an absolute disgrace. They have not consulted with anyone, they have just decided 'this is what we're going to do.' This must be Sir Jim Ratcliffe's way of 'putting the Manchester back into Manchester United.'

"I am going to assume he's a smart man, as he's made a bob or two during his life. He knew what we was getting on board with. If things are so bad he has to penalise match going fans like this, then it really is a shocking state of affairs."

"I have spoken to three or four supporters clubs who are worried about closing," Steve continued. "They rely on filling coaches to the game, and if they can't fill the coach because people can't afford tickets, then they will die. Match-going fans are being penalised, it's not on."

Asked if he thought the club may reverse their decision given the level of anger, Steve said: "probably not." "But will we keep fighting? Absolutely. This is the start, we are working with other Premier League teams. Unity is our strength and our voice will only get louder."

Everton fan David Fehily, 61, and chair of the club's fan advisory board, Dave Kelly, 66, were among those of the Blue persuasion who came to show their support for the campaign spearheaded by The Football Supporters Association.

"We believe this isn't a club-by-club issue, this is a national issue" David said. "Everton is unusual as we have a high number of juniors and OAPs who this would affect. We have to stand together."

![Image 1](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491380.ece/ALTERNATES/s1200/0_GettyImages-2187193355.jpg)

Manchester United recorded their biggest Premier League win of the season by beating Everton 4-0 at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee, who started together for the first time under Ruben Amorim, helped themself to a brace each to put Everton to the sword and elevate United up into the top half of the Premier League table.

Rashford gave United a 34th-minute lead, firing a deflected effort past Everton goalkeeper Jordan Pickford, before Zirkzee scored his first goal since the opening weekend of the season seven minutes later.

United put the game beyond doubt less than 30 seconds into the second half when Rashford claimed his second, firing past Pickford after being slipped in by the lively Amad.

Amad then created United's fourth goal that was turned in by Zirkzee for his second goal of the afternoon.

The only negative for United was that they lost both Lisandro Martinez and Kobbie Mainoo to suspension. They were both yellow carded in the second half, each collecting their fifth booking of the season in the process.

**You can recap how Sunday afternoon's game unfolded by scanning through our blog below...**

15:44KEY EVENT

### REPORT: Amad responds perfectly to Amorim's touchline reactions in United win

Jarrad Branthwaite did not get his move to United in the summer yet he stepped up as their 12th man against Everton.

A deflection and a dozy pass from the centre back gifted United both of their first-half goals to turn the game on its head. Branthwaite skulked off at half-time with his head bowed, tugging his shirt in the hope it would be big enough to conceal his embarrassed expression. There was a half left to play yet Everton were done.

United were otherwise unconvincing in a first half so troubling that Ruben Amorim was plotting a double substitution at half-time. Branthwaite's collapse caused his teammates to also fold. United ran away with it without running much.

After two 3-0 reverses at Old Trafford, the thrashings are being meted out by the home side. There was a hearty and celebratory rendition of "Amorim's Red and White Army" from the Stretford End before the hour, with victory already assured. This was United's first four-goal victory in the Premier League since the opening day of the 2021-22 season.

15:28KEY EVENT

### PLAYER RATINGS: Amad brilliant as United put Everton to the sword

United recorded their biggest Premier League victory of the season with a 4-0 win over Everton at Old Trafford this afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee each helped themselves to a brace, both scoring either side of half-time, to secure the first Premier League win of the Ruben Amorim era.

Here is a flavour of how Samuel Luckhurst rated United's players out of 10...

**Andre Onana**

Didn't do anything wrong during a difficult first half for United and had a much quieter second 45 minutes as he kept a clean sheet. Saved late on from Dominic Calvert-Lewin. 7

**Noussair Mazraoui**

Had a more testing time against Iliman Ndiaye but came through it to help keep United's sheet clean before he was rested. 6

**Matthijs de Ligt**

Outpaced by Beto for Everton's best chance with the game goalless as he failed to dominate another defender-striker duel. Came off before the hour. 5

Branthwaite, so solid at the start, has become a 12th man for United.

![Image 1](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491380.ece/ALTERNATES/s1200/0_GettyImages-2187193355.jpg)

Manchester United recorded their biggest Premier League win of the season by beating Everton 4-0 at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee, who started together for the first time under Ruben Amorim, helped themself to a brace each to put Everton to the sword and elevate United up into the top half of the Premier League table.

Rashford gave United a 34th-minute lead, firing a deflected effort past Everton goalkeeper Jordan Pickford, before Zirkzee scored his first goal since the opening weekend of the season seven minutes later.

United put the game beyond doubt less than 30 seconds into the second half when Rashford claimed his second, firing past Pickford after being slipped in by the lively Amad.

Amad then created United's fourth goal that was turned in by Zirkzee for his second goal of the afternoon.

The only negative for United was that they lost both Lisandro Martinez and Kobbie Mainoo to suspension. They were both yellow carded in the second half, each collecting their fifth booking of the season in the process.

**You can recap how Sunday afternoon's game unfolded by scanning through our blog below...**

15:44KEY EVENT

### REPORT: Amad responds perfectly to Amorim's touchline reactions in United win

Jarrad Branthwaite did not get his move to United in the summer yet he stepped up as their 12th man against Everton.

A deflection and a dozy pass from the centre back gifted United both of their first-half goals to turn the game on its head. Branthwaite skulked off at half-time with his head bowed, tugging his shirt in the hope it would be big enough to conceal his embarrassed expression. There was a half left to play yet Everton were done.

United were otherwise unconvincing in a first half so troubling that Ruben Amorim was plotting a double substitution at half-time. Branthwaite's collapse caused his teammates to also fold. United ran away with it without running much.

After two 3-0 reverses at Old Trafford, the thrashings are being meted out by the home side. There was a hearty and celebratory rendition of "Amorim's Red and White Army" from the Stretford End before the hour, with victory already assured. This was United's first four-goal victory in the Premier League since the opening day of the 2021-22 season.

### PLAYER RATINGS: Amad brilliant as United put Everton to the sword

United recorded their biggest Premier League victory of the season with a 4-0 win over Everton at Old Trafford this afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee each helped themselves to a brace, both scoring either side of half-time, to secure the first Premier League win of the Ruben Amorim era.

Here is a flavour of how Samuel Luckhurst rated United's players out of 10...

**Andre Onana**

Didn't do anything wrong during a difficult first half for United and had a much quieter second 45 minutes as he kept a clean sheet. Saved late on from Dominic Calvert-Lewin. 7

**Noussair Mazraoui**

Had a more testing time against Iliman Ndiaye but came through it to help keep United's sheet clean before he was rested. 6

**Matthijs de Ligt**

Outpaced by Beto for Everton's best chance with the game goalless as he failed to dominate another defender-striker duel. Came off before the hour. 5

=============================================================================================

![Image 1](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491380.ece/ALTERNATES/s1200/0_GettyImages-2187193355.jpg)

Manchester United recorded their biggest Premier League win of the season by beating Everton 4-0 at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee, who started together for the first time under Ruben Amorim, helped themself to a brace each to put Everton to the sword and elevate United up into the top half of the Premier League table.

Rashford gave United a 34th-minute lead, firing a deflected effort past Everton goalkeeper Jordan Pickford, before Zirkzee scored his first goal since the opening weekend of the season seven minutes later.

United put the game beyond doubt less than 30 seconds into the second half when Rashford claimed his second, firing past Pickford after being slipped in by the lively Amad.

Amad then created United's fourth goal that was turned in by Zirkzee for his second goal of the afternoon.

The only negative for United was that they lost both Lisandro Martinez and Kobbie Mainoo to suspension. They were both yellow carded in the second half, each collecting their fifth booking of the season in the process.

**You can recap how Sunday afternoon's game unfolded by scanning through our blog below...**

15:44KEY EVENT

### REPORT: Amad responds perfectly to Amorim's touchline reactions in United win

Jarrad Branthwaite did not get his move to United in the summer yet he stepped up as their 12th man against Everton.

A deflection and a dozy pass from the centre back gifted United both of their first-half goals to turn the game on its head. Branthwaite skulked off at half-time with his head bowed, tugging his shirt in the hope it would be big enough to conceal his embarrassed expression. There was a half left to play yet Everton were done.

United were otherwise unconvincing in a first half so troubling that Ruben Amorim was plotting a double substitution at half-time. Branthwaite's collapse caused his teammates to also fold. United ran away with it without running much.

After two 3-0 reverses at Old Trafford, the thrashings are being meted out by the home side. There was a hearty and celebratory rendition of "Amorim's Red and White Army" from the Stretford End before the hour, with victory already assured. This was United's first four-goal victory in the Premier League since the opening day of the 2021-22 season.

### PLAYER RATINGS: Amad brilliant as United put Everton to the sword

United recorded their biggest Premier League victory of the season with a 4-0 win over Everton at Old Trafford this afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee each helped themselves to a brace, both scoring either side of half-time, to secure the first Premier League win of the Ruben Amorim era.

Here is a flavour of how Samuel Luckhurst rated United's players out of 10...

**Andre Onana**

Didn't do anything wrong during a difficult first half for United and had a much quieter second 45 minutes as he kept a clean sheet. Saved late on from Dominic Calvert-Lewin. 7

**Noussair Mazraoui**

Had a more testing time against Iliman Ndiaye but came through it to help keep United's sheet clean before he was rested. 6

**Matthijs de Ligt**

Outpaced by Beto for Everton's best chance with the game goalless as he failed to dominate another defender-striker duel. Came off before the hour. 5

14:14Samuel Luckhurst

### 43' - MUN 2-0 EFC - United are well on top now

That deflection has turned the game on its head and United should run away with this now. All of Zirkzee's teammates are pleased as punch for him. It's his first goal in 18 games and second in 19. He had not looked like getting a sniff until he slid in there but it was well-taken after Fernandes seized on Branthwaite's sloppiness.

Branthwaite, so solid at the start, has become a 12th man for United.

Manchester United vs Everton highlights and reaction as Rashford and Zirkzee score in big win
=============================================================================================

![Image 1](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30491380.ece/ALTERNATES/s1200/0_GettyImages-2187193355.jpg)

Manchester United recorded their biggest Premier League win of the season by beating Everton 4-0 at Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee, who started together for the first time under Ruben Amorim, helped themself to a brace each to put Everton to the sword and elevate United up into the top half of the Premier League table.

Rashford gave United a 34th-minute lead, firing a deflected effort past Everton goalkeeper Jordan Pickford, before Zirkzee scored his first goal since the opening weekend of the season seven minutes later.

United put the game beyond doubt less than 30 seconds into the second half when Rashford claimed his second, firing past Pickford after being slipped in by the lively Amad.

Amad then created United's fourth goal that was turned in by Zirkzee for his second goal of the afternoon.

The only negative for United was that they lost both Lisandro Martinez and Kobbie Mainoo to suspension. They were both yellow carded in the second half, each collecting their fifth booking of the season in the process.

**You can recap how Sunday afternoon's game unfolded by scanning through our blog below...**

15:44KEY EVENT

### REPORT: Amad responds perfectly to Amorim's touchline reactions in United win

Jarrad Branthwaite did not get his move to United in the summer yet he stepped up as their 12th man against Everton.

A deflection and a dozy pass from the centre back gifted United both of their first-half goals to turn the game on its head. Branthwaite skulked off at half-time with his head bowed, tugging his shirt in the hope it would be big enough to conceal his embarrassed expression. There was a half left to play yet Everton were done.

United were otherwise unconvincing in a first half so troubling that Ruben Amorim was plotting a double substitution at half-time. Branthwaite's collapse caused his teammates to also fold. United ran away with it without running much.

After two 3-0 reverses at Old Trafford, the thrashings are being meted out by the home side. There was a hearty and celebratory rendition of "Amorim's Red and White Army" from the Stretford End before the hour, with victory already assured. This was United's first four-goal victory in the Premier League since the opening day of the 2021-22 season.

### PLAYER RATINGS: Amad brilliant as United put Everton to the sword

United recorded their biggest Premier League victory of the season with a 4-0 win over Everton at Old Trafford this afternoon.

Marcus Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee each helped themselves to a brace, both scoring either side of half-time, to secure the first Premier League win of the Ruben Amorim era.

Here is a flavour of how Samuel Luckhurst rated United's players out of 10...

**Andre Onana**

Didn't do anything wrong during a difficult first half for United and had a much quieter second 45 minutes as he kept a clean sheet. Saved late on from Dominic Calvert-Lewin. 7

**Noussair Mazraoui**

Had a more testing time against Iliman Ndiaye but came through it to help keep United's sheet clean before he was rested. 6

**Matthijs de Ligt**

Outpaced by Beto for Everton's best chance with the game goalless as he failed to dominate another defender-striker duel. Came off before the hour. 5

14:14Samuel Luckhurst

### 43' - MUN 2-0 EFC - United are well on top now

That deflection has turned the game on its head and United should run away with this now. All of Zirkzee's teammates are pleased as punch for him. It's his first goal in 18 games and second in 19. He had not looked like getting a sniff until he slid in there but it was well-taken after Fernandes seized on Branthwaite's sloppiness.

Branthwaite, so solid at the start, has become a 12th man for United.

Jadon Sancho shows true Manchester United colours after Everton victory
=======================================================================

Manchester United picked up a big victory in Ruben Amorim's first home Premier League match as Everton fell to a 4-0 defeat
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

![Image 1: Jadon Sancho on the ball for Chelsea vs Aston Villa](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30493075.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187701113.jpg)

Manchester United's loanee winger Jadon Sancho has sent his support to Bruno Fernandes and Marcus Rashford after the Reds' 4-0 win over Everton on Sunday.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were dominant against the Merseyside club with Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee both grabbing braces either side of half-time. The win moved Ruben Amorim's team back into the top half of the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) table, just four points behind [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) in fifth who lost 2-0 at [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) on Sunday afternoon.

As we have become accustomed to following victories, [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) players took to Instagram at full-time to celebrate the victory. [Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) posted: "Top team performance," while captain [Fernandes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/bruno-fernandes) added: "A nice Sunday at home."

**READ MORE: [United player ratings vs Everton](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30490967)**

**READ MORE: [Sancho has just left Amorim another warning](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/jadon-sancho-just-left-ruben-30484841)**

Both posts were liked by [Sancho](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jadon-sancho) despite him being on loan at Premier League rivals [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc). The winger joined the London club with an obligation to buy at the end of the season.

At the time, Sancho's relationship with then-manager [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) remained frosty. Despite the Dutchman insisting that he had buried the hatchet with the English winger, the consensus at United was that he would be better off leaving.

After starting well at Stamford Bridge, Sancho's form did drop but a good performance at Heidenheim in the Conference League earned him a start against Aston Villa this weekend. The United loanee played 71 minutes as Enzo Maresca's side ran out 3-0 winners while the Reds were picking up three points.

Sancho's future at Chelsea will be confirmed at the end of the season with United banking £25m in the deal.

data: {"title":"Jadon Sancho shows true Man United colours after Everton victory","description":"Manchester United picked up a big victory in Ruben Amorim's first home Premier League match as Everton fell to a 4-0 defeat","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/jadon-sancho-shows-true-manchester-30493001","content":"Jadon Sancho shows true Manchester United colours after Everton victory - Manchester Evening News
===============

Jadon Sancho shows true Manchester United colours after Everton victory
=======================================================================

Manchester United picked up a big victory in Ruben Amorim's first home Premier League match as Everton fell to a 4-0 defeat
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments4](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/jadon-sancho-shows-true-manchester-30493001#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   20:00, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Jadon Sancho on the ball for Chelsea vs Aston Villa](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30493075.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187701113.jpg)

Jadon Sancho on the ball for Chelsea vs Aston Villa (Image: Darren Walsh/Chelsea FC via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United's loanee winger Jadon Sancho has sent his support to Bruno Fernandes and Marcus Rashford after the Reds' 4-0 win over Everton on Sunday.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were dominant against the Merseyside club with Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee both grabbing braces either side of half-time. The win moved Ruben Amorim's team back into the top half of the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) table, just four points behind [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) in fifth who lost 2-0 at [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) on Sunday afternoon.

As we have become accustomed to following victories, [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) players took to Instagram at full-time to celebrate the victory. [Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) posted: "Top team performance," while captain [Fernandes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/bruno-fernandes) added: "A nice Sunday at home."

**READ MORE: [United player ratings vs Everton](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30490967)**

**READ MORE: [Sancho has just left Amorim another warning](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/jadon-sancho-just-left-ruben-30484841)**

Both posts were liked by [Sancho](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jadon-sancho) despite him being on loan at Premier League rivals [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc). The winger joined the London club with an obligation to buy at the end of the season.

> [View this post on Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/DDCzoDqMLma/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)[A post shared by Bruno Fernandes (@brunofernandes8)](https://www.instagram.com/p/DDCzoDqMLma/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)

At the time, Sancho's relationship with then-manager [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) remained frosty. Despite the Dutchman insisting that he had buried the hatchet with the English winger, the consensus at United was that he would be better off leaving.

After starting well at Stamford Bridge, Sancho's form did drop but a good performance at Heidenheim in the Conference League earned him a start against Aston Villa this weekend. The United loanee played 71 minutes as Enzo Maresca's side ran out 3-0 winners while the Reds were picking up three points.

> [View this post on Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/DDCz1kJOvNk/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)[A post shared by Marcus Rashford MBE (@marcusrashford)](https://www.instagram.com/p/DDCz1kJOvNk/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)

Sancho's future at Chelsea will be confirmed at the end of the season with United banking £25m in the deal.

data: {"title":"Jadon Sancho shows true Man United colours after Everton victory","description":"Manchester United picked up a big victory in Ruben Amorim's first home Premier League match as Everton fell to a 4-0 defeat","url":"https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/jadon-sancho-shows-true-manchester-30493001","content":"Jadon Sancho shows true Manchester United colours after Everton victory - Manchester Evening News
===============
                                   

 

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

Jadon Sancho shows true Manchester United colours after Everton victory
=======================================================================

Manchester United picked up a big victory in Ruben Amorim's first home Premier League match as Everton fell to a 4-0 defeat
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

[men](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/)

*   Bookmark
    
*   Share
*   
*   
*   

*   [Comments4](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/jadon-sancho-shows-true-manchester-30493001#comments-wrapper "Comments")

[Sport](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/)

By

[Jack Flintham](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/authors/jack-flintham/)Sport Central Audience Writer

*   20:00, 1 DEC 2024

*   Bookmark
    

![Image 1: Jadon Sancho on the ball for Chelsea vs Aston Villa](https://i2-prod.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/incoming/article30493075.ece/ALTERNATES/s615/0_GettyImages-2187701113.jpg)

Jadon Sancho on the ball for Chelsea vs Aston Villa (Image: Darren Walsh/Chelsea FC via Getty Images)

![Image 2: Manchester Evening News logo - whatsapp community](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/@trinitymirrordigital/chameleon-branding/publications/men/img/icon-men.png)

###### Get the latest MEN breaking news on WhatsApp

Our community members are treated to special offers, promotions and adverts from us and our partners. You can check out at any time. [More info](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/privacy-notice)

[Join us on WhatsApp](https://chat.whatsapp.com/IG57qlIoDZM56XwrenyELG)

Manchester United's loanee winger Jadon Sancho has sent his support to Bruno Fernandes and Marcus Rashford after the Reds' 4-0 win over Everton on Sunday.

[United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) were dominant against the Merseyside club with Rashford and Joshua Zirkzee both grabbing braces either side of half-time. The win moved Ruben Amorim's team back into the top half of the [Premier League](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/premier-league) table, just four points behind [Manchester City](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-city-fc) in fifth who lost 2-0 at [Liverpool](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/liverpool-fc) on Sunday afternoon.

As we have become accustomed to following victories, [United](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/manchester-united-fc) players took to Instagram at full-time to celebrate the victory. [Rashford](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/marcus-rashford) posted: "Top team performance," while captain [Fernandes](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/bruno-fernandes) added: "A nice Sunday at home."

**READ MORE: [United player ratings vs Everton](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/manchester-united-player-ratings-amad-30490967)**

**READ MORE: [Sancho has just left Amorim another warning](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/jadon-sancho-just-left-ruben-30484841)**

Both posts were liked by [Sancho](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/jadon-sancho) despite him being on loan at Premier League rivals [Chelsea](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/chelsea-fc). The winger joined the London club with an obligation to buy at the end of the season.

> [View this post on Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/DDCzoDqMLma/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)[A post shared by Bruno Fernandes (@brunofernandes8)](https://www.instagram.com/p/DDCzoDqMLma/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)

At the time, Sancho's relationship with then-manager [Erik ten Hag](https://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/all-about/erik-ten-hag) remained frosty. Despite the Dutchman insisting that he had buried the hatchet with the English winger, the consensus at United was that he would be better off leaving.

After starting well at Stamford Bridge, Sancho's form did drop but a good performance at Heidenheim in the Conference League earned him a start against Aston Villa this weekend. The United loanee played 71 minutes as Enzo Maresca's side ran out 3-0 winners while the Reds were picking up three points.

> [View this post on Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/p/DDCz1kJOvNk/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)[A post shared by Marcus Rashford MBE (@marcusrashford)](https://www.instagram.com/p/DDCz1kJOvNk/?utm_source=ig_embed&utm_campaign=loading)

Sancho's future at Chelsea will be confirmed at the end of the season with United banking £25m in the deal.
